intro: Ageratum houstonianum f. niveum, commonly known as the white ageratum, is a flowering plant characterized by its fluffy, white or pale blue flower clusters. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is native to Mexico and Central America. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring narrow, gray-green leaves and showy inflorescences. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and is often cultivated as an ornamental plant in gardens and floral arrangements.
